reasoning: Adding two SQLAlchemy models with multiple relationships, enums, and JSONB fields. Well-defined scope (1-2 files, single service) with existing patterns to follow, but requires careful relationship configuration and understanding of FK constraints.

scope.notes: Primary file: backend/app/models/checklist_template.py. May need to update model exports. Localized to backend model layer.

integrations.notes: No external integrations. Using existing SQLAlchemy ORM. Standard Python packages only.

infrastructure.notes: New database tables via model definitions. JSONB fields require PostgreSQL. Migrations are separate task. No Docker or config changes needed.

knowledge.notes: Target file already exists with similar models (ChecklistTemplate, ChecklistItemTemplate). Can follow existing patterns for UUIDs, timestamps, relationships, and JSONB fields.

concerns: Foreign key relationships must reference correct models (5 FKs total)
JSONB field type hints and handling (3 JSONB fields)
Two enum definitions need proper SQLAlchemy configuration
Optional fields (area_id, unit_identifier, completed_at, note, signature_file_id) need proper nullable handling
risk.notes: Medium risk because models are foundational - incorrect relationships or FK constraints could break queries across the application. However, requirements are well-defined and testable.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Database models are foundational and require testing. Unit tests for model instantiation and field validation. Integration tests for FK constraints and relationship queries. No security scan needed (no auth/payment logic). No staging deployment needed (models only, no runtime changes).
